fields.description:
Please support a list of email addresses associated with each Cloud user, rather than only one.

Discussion in [JST-197336|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-197336]

h3. Use case
Our users switch frequently between email addresses in two domains. Some of them are usually {{user@a.com}} and some of them are usually {{user@b.com}}, but many of them switch between the two.
* For Jira Cloud, we use doubled mail handlers to receive messages regardless whether the user sends their request to {{helpdesk@a.com}} or to {{helpdesk@b.com}} - they both become issues in the same IT project.
But If a user sends a message as {{user@b.com}} but their Atlassian Cloud account knows them as {{user@a.com}}, the ticket that's created won't know it's the same user.

* Similar confusion ensues with our Confluence Cloud activity.

How can we associate multiple email addresses with each Atlassian Cloud user?

h3. Atlassian Support's proposed workaround
{quote}
Currently there is no way to associate multiple email addresses with a single JIRA account. You would have to setup two different accounts for each user in order for them to use multiple email addresses.
One thing you could do is have an email account that multiple people use to submit tickets to JIRA with. You could create one account for this email address. Then under your specific project you could set that account as the default reporter. This would only consume one license but would allow multiple people to submit tickets using it.
{quote}

h3. Reason the workaround is unsuitable

Obviously we don't want to manage twice as many user accounts, and we have security-driven policies prohibiting shared access to account credentials. Both workarounds separate the individuals from the issues with which they're concerned - they'd need to login to both accounts to interact with both lists.
fields.summary: list of email addresses per Cloud user

h3. Problem Definition

At present we are using an older build of Java 8 on our Cloud applications. This build does not include the QuoVadis root certificate in it's keystore.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Upgrade our cloud applications to Java 8u91 to add those certificates to the keystore: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u91-relnotes-2949462.html.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Upgrade to Java 8u91 to add QuoVadis SSL root certificates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the new realise of 26 APR 2016 in JIRA Software:
{quote}
Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink.
{quote}

Earlier, in the description or comments links to other issues were showing only the issue number. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add ability to customize the links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments)
 
h3. Workaround 
Not available
fields.summary: Add Ability to customise links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments)

fields.description:
Problem: 
We, at InTENSO (Atlassian Partner), are facing problem that side panel (page tree) in Confluence Space is missing for anonymous access. 

Background: 
1. When logged in, everything is fine. 
2. When accessing space anonymously, the side panel is completely missing - not only page tree, but all the panel content (including space name and icon). 
3. The problem is present only for one space https://intenso.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FLO/TestFLO 
4. Settings compared and set as in other spaces (where everything is fine, for example https://intenso.atlassian.net/wiki/display/SPFJSD )
5. The problem is gone, when anonymous gain permission to Add Pages (which is
now set, we only added temporarily restriction for editing)
6. some users icons are missing too (for example when selecting them in restrictions menu)
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud - side page tree missing

fields.description:
Ticket descriptions have suddenly started rendering with icons and descriptions instead of just hyperlinking the ticket ID.  This suddenly started happening tonight.

We use JIRA ticket IDs extensively to identify our requirements, specifications, etc.  In some cases the ticket IDs are used to name files, which are then mentioned in test procedures.  This rendering change causes the text to read incorrectly.  This is affecting across all our whole system and we have a fair number of tickets. 

This is a highly user-visible and incompatible change from previous behavior.  In addition I couldn't find a knob to toggle it off.
fields.summary: ticket descriptions inlined when mentioned

fields.description:
Hello,

In our situation we have seen the burndown-chart isn't capturing all the changes which were made, which results in an incorrect burndown-chart.

We removed 4 item from the current sprint, and added 4 other items to the current sprint again. With the same Story-point count, so we expected the burndown-chart to remain unchanged.

Attached I have added some screenshot to explain the situation:
- 1: incorrect-burndown-chart.png - this image show how our burndown looks like currently.
- 2: burndown-chart-log.png - this image show the logged data which is shown by the burndown-chart. It shows we removed 2 items from the sprint and added 4 items to the sprint.
- 3: issue-history-log-{nr},png - these images show the history-log of the issues we also removed. Since we removed 4 items from the sprint (2016W13) and added 4 items again. So 2 items, which were removed from the sprint, were not logged by the burndown-log.

Hopefully this explains the situation clear enough, please let me know if you need more information.

Regards,

Michael Bom
fields.summary: Burndown-report showing incorrect graph

fields.description:
When our teams are executing daily scrum two story attributes are most important. E.g.:
* FixFor version
* Story Owner
If you want to see this info you must click on the story to display it on the left. But our teams prints JIRA Boards and we are conducting daily scrum using paper prints of the JIRA Board (this gives us possibility of writing additional info to individual tasks/stories). We print JIRA Boards several times per week and this works great in pratice. But every time we print JIRA Board we must write FixFor version on the left hand side of the Story header in JIRA Board print. This process is really tedious and most importantly unnecessary.

We propose following functionality:
User could add one|two|three additional fields that would be visible in the JIRA Board for individual Story (left hand side of the Story header, on the right you have story ID and summary). Fields could be added via JIRA Board configuration (role Board Administrator).
fields.summary: Show additional Story info in JIRA board

fields.description:
The Blobstore support scripts are hard-coded to connect to JIRA at localhost:2990, but based on this we're currently seeing cases where JIRA instances can't display attachments or are flooded by connection refused errors in logs.

h3. Version affected
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Workaround 
* To contact Atlassian Support to update the port being used between JIRA and Blobstore
fields.summary: Connection refused between JIRA and Blobstore

 * Dropdown Menu Items Blurry if Browser Zoomed In

h3. Environment
* Chrome Browser
* JIRA 7.2.0-OD-05-030
* Confluence 1000.7.0
* Bamboo 5.10-OD-15-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any Cloud instance
# Zoom out with the browser (90% or lower Zoom percentage)
# Click on any drop-down menu and observe

h3. Expected Results
 * Clear and crisp menus

h3. Actual Results
 * Blurry font

h3. Notes
It looks like this issue only occurs in Chrome, while Firefox and Safari have been tested to work fine.

fields.description:
Reference  [JST-185780]

Jira Dashboards configured as Wallboards should be entirely accessible to anonymous users (if system, project, & filter permissions are set accordingly).  For example, currently, when a dashboard is configured with a handful of pie chart filter results for a given project, when the dashboard is accessed anonymously (without logging in as a user), the dashboard will display but the graphs will not populate.  Ideally, all non-restricted widgets and their results should be accessible (view-able, if not interactive).  At a minimum, "executive summary" type widgets (line/bar/pie charts which do not display issue details) should be made view-able by anonymous users, if so desired.
fields.summary: Make Wallboards Anonymously Viewable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in Atlassian Cloud, there are two administrative groups that grant administrative access to all applications:
{{site-admins}}
{{admiinistrators}}

In some cases, users would like some of their users to be able to ONLY administer/have access to ONE application in their Cloud suite.

Example: User needs to create projects and administer in JIRA, but does not need Confluence access. Said user must be in {{administrators}} group to do this. But that group grants administrative access to Confluence as well. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create administrator groups for Confluence and JIRA, and limit the {{administrators}} group to just the application necessary. 

h3. Workaround
Create separate Cloud account with the application you'd like to deny access for the {{site-admins}} and {{administrators}} groups in your original instance. However, this is not a great workaround.
fields.summary: Create separate administrator groups for different Cloud applications

fields.description:
Scrolling items in a project backlog is a poor experience using a mobile device such as an iPad.

To scroll the list of 'issues', every person I've 'user tested' tries to scroll the list with their finger, but the item they touched on the list is just dragged and dropped instead.

THere is only a narrow section on the screen that you can use to scroll the list. Outside of that, the scrolling action magnifies the screen. 

This is terrible to use. I suggest that you select a button on the screen to put you into drag and drop mode. And the default mode should be simple scrolling of the list wherever you touch and push up or down with your finger.
fields.summary: Scrolling - Poor usability scrolling on mobile UI using iPad etc
